blocks.text: The ER model is a conceptual representation of data. It helps in designing databases by identifying entities, their attributes, and relationships between them.

list: Entity: A real-world object or concept (e.g., Student, Product).
Attribute: Properties of an entity (e.g., name, price, age).
Relationship: Association between entities (e.g., Student enrolls in Course).
ER Diagram: Visual representation of entities, attributes, and relationships.

image.caption: Example of an ER diagram showing entities, attributes, and relationships.

blocks.title: Design Tip
blocks.text: Creating an ER diagram before implementation helps identify the structure and constraints, reducing errors during database design.
